contentrichtext.text: '''Inventory''' are a collective of [[United Kingdom|British]] [[artists]], [[writers]] and art theorists, founded in 1996. Some of their pieces see them engage in [[performance art]] in public spaces. ''Coagulum (Oxford Street)'' in 2000, saw them form into a close group on [[London]]'s [[Oxford Street]], thus disrupting the flow of pedestrians, before entering a shopping centre and dancing to the piped music. For another piece, they played [[football (soccer)|football]] on [[The Mall (London)|The Mall]] with a rubber skull, using [[Buckingham Palace]] and [[Admiralty Arch]] as goals. Other pieces, such as the [[installation art|installation]] ''Requiem For The Empty Quarter'' at the [[The Approach Gallery|The approach]] gallery, [[Bethnal Green]] in 2002, used modified and written-upon objects found on the street. In 2003, Inventory were nominated for the [[Beck's Futures]] prize. ==External links== *[http://www.theapproach.co.uk/exhibitions/representations/ Inventory's page at the Approach Gallery] *[http://www.fiercesociology.org Inventory's website] [[Category:British performance artists]]
